>>Neuroscientist: Interestingly, the evolution of neuroscience is a testament to how our understanding of the brain has transformed over centuries. Imaging reveals the unseen, allowing us to visualize neural activity and connectivity in ways that were unimaginable just a few decades ago. >>Neuroscientist: In fact, the historical development of neuroscience is not just a series of isolated discoveries but rather a cumulative progression that has led to our current understanding. For instance, Santiago Ramón y Cajal's neuron doctrine laid the foundation for modern neurobiology, and Eric Kandel's work on memory storage in neurons has furthered our grasp on cognitive functions.
